entry.name: The nuclear proteome of the green alga Chlamydomonas reinhardtii.
entry.description: PRIDE ID: 13764. Data published as part of Proteomics. 2012 12:95-100 ([[http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22065562 PubMed]]. From the Abstract: {{i}}... Here, we present an analysis of the nuclear proteome of the sequenced Chlamydomonas strain cc503. Using LC-MS/MS, we identified 672 proteins from nuclei isolates with a maximum 1% peptide spectrum false discovery rate. Besides well-known proteins (e.g. histones), transcription factors and other transcriptional regulators (e.g. tubby and HMG) were identified ...{{/i}}

additional_fields.field: Department of Molecular Biology, Prof. Dr. Bernd Mueller-Roeber, Institute of Biochemistry and Biology
